subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Manchester United finally found its scoring touch yesterday, beating Wigan, 4-0, and taking the Premier League lead for the first time this season.Cristiano Ronaldo had two goals and Wayne Rooney and Carlos Tévez also scored to give United 20 points, 1 more than Arsenal, which is host to Sunderland today. In yesterday’s other Premier League game, Aston Villa beat West Ham, 1-0.
